body_html:
@peterjc123 I just try to run code as you suggest. It still doesn't print anything.
For the "broken pipe" issue, referring to part of my code below, the error occur when I start process for test script, before the for loop.

processes = []
p = mp.Process(target=test, args=(data_list, conv_list, name_list, model_params, shared_model, seed0, save_path, min_time))
p.start() #<< error on this line
processes.append(p)

for rank in range(0, training_params['num_processes']):
p = mp.Process(target=train, args=(data_train, conv_train, model_params, training_params, shared_model, optimizer, seed0 + rank))
p.run()
processes.append(p)
for p in processes:
p.join()

body:
@peterjc123 I just try to run code as you suggest. It still doesn't print anything.
For the "broken pipe" issue, referring to part of my code below, the error occur when I start process for test script, before the for loop.

processes = [] 
p = mp.Process(target=test, args=(data_list, conv_list, name_list, model_params, shared_model, seed0, save_path, min_time)) 
p.start() #<< error on this line
processes.append(p) 

for rank in range(0, training_params['num_processes']): 
    p = mp.Process(target=train, args=(data_train, conv_train, model_params, training_params, shared_model, optimizer, seed0 + rank))
    p.run()
    processes.append(p)
for p in processes:
    p.join()
